Name: PyCon 2014
Description: PyCon 2014 was held in Montréal, featuring a wide range of tutorials, talks, and sprints. Participants praised the rich content and networking opportunities.

Name: PyCon 2015
Description: Building on previous successes, PyCon 2015 in Montréal offered new insights into Python development with extensive tutorial sessions and keynote speeches.

Name: PyCon 2016
Description: Held in Portland, PyCon 2016 was recognized for its inclusive approach and broad array of presentations catering to various skill levels.

Name: PyCon 2017
Description: Returning to Portland, PyCon 2017 brought together experts and enthusiasts with engaging tutorials, talks, and a bustling job fair.

Name: PyCon 2018
Description: Marking its first year in Cleveland, PyCon 2018 was lauded for its dynamic sessions and welcoming atmosphere.

Name: PyCon 2019
Description: With engaging sprints and workshops, PyCon 2019 built upon its community-driven roots in Cleveland.

Name: PyCon 2020
Description: Originally planned for Pittsburgh, PyCon 2020 was held online due to the COVID-19 pandemic, offering virtual sessions and keynotes.

Name: PyCon 2021
Description: With a refined and fully virtual format, PyCon 2021 continued to deliver quality content and fostered global interaction.

Name: PyCon 2022
Description: Returning to an in-person event, PyCon 2022 in Salt Lake City brought renewed energy and engagement to the community.

Name: PyCon 2023
Description: Celebrating its 20th anniversary, PyCon 2023 in Salt Lake City offered an expansive program reflecting on Python's growth and future.
